items.title: Everyoneâ€™s in awe of â€˜tri-foldâ€™ phones, and now projectors are all â€˜yeah, us, tooâ€™
items.summary: The Aurzen ZIP brings foldable design to projectors to deliver new viewing options and enhance portability.
items.body: The Aurzen ZIP projector has a Z-shaped folding design that collapses to just one inch thick. A 5,000 mAh battery delivers 90 minutes of operation on a charge. In addition to the folding design letting you easily direct the ZIPâ€™s output, you can turn it on its side for screen-mirroring portrait mode. Listen, foldables are cool â€” who doesnâ€™t love big things that transform into smaller things â€” but theyâ€™re also becoming a little been-there-done-that as manufacturers really start getting comfortable with the form factor. And that sort of familiarity is probably exactly why so many of us have been shifting our interests slightly towards the growing crop of â€œtri-foldâ€ devices like Samsungâ€™s upcoming TriFold or the new Mate XTs . Editorâ€™s note: When did the mobile industry forget how to count? All these things fold twice , not three times. Get it together.

items.title: Google leaks its new Nest Cams and Nest Doorbell inside the Home app
items.summary: The new Nest devices could feature a better camera and new Gemini-powered features.
items.body: Credit: AssembleDebug / Android Authority Images and mentions of the upcoming Nest Cam Indoor, Nest Cam Outdoor, and Nest Doorbell have been spotted in the latest Google Home app update. Previous leaks suggest all the devices could feature 2K video recording, digital zoom up to 6x with Zoom and Crop, support for Gemini, and come in multiple color options. Google is preparing to launch some new Nest-branded products. The company sneakily teased a new Gemini-equipped Nest speaker at the Pixel 10 â€˜s launch event. Thanks to a leak, weâ€™ve also gotten a look at new Nest-branded cameras and a doorbell . Weâ€™ve now spotted more images of the Nest Cam and Nest Doorbell, and they come straight from Google itself. Weâ€™ve spotted mentions of Googleâ€™s upcoming Nest devices within the latest version of the Google Home app.

items.title: IFA 2025 Highlight: MAMMOTIONâ€™s Tri-Fusion Positioning System takes its robot lawn mowers to the next level
items.summary: MAMMOTION Tri-Fusion Positioning System fuses LiDAR, RTK, and Vision for wire-free, Â±1cm precision lawn care on any terrain.
items.body: Credit: Stephen Schenck / Android Authority Robot mowers may seem like a niche product, but the amount of time you save and the physical labor you avoid from not having to mow your own lawn canâ€™t be stated enough. It started with low-powered devices that would get stuck on slopes and required physical boundaries that were difficult to install. But these robots have evolved exponentially since, with current generation robot mowers able to navigate using virtual boundaries and handle different types of terrain. No robot lawn mower was perfect, though, with navigation and terrain struggles remaining significant pain points. Thatâ€™s exactly what MAMMOTION hopes to address with its latest Tri-Fusion Positioning System on the new LUBA mini AWD LiDAR, which the company is showcasing at IFA 2025. Hereâ€™s what you need to know.

items.title: 5 reasons Iâ€™d buy the Galaxy Tab S11 over the S11 Ultra
items.summary: The Galaxy Tab S11 Ultra is undoubtedly a pro-grade upgrade, but the standard Tab S11 is the better fit for most people.
items.body: Itâ€™s that time of the year when Samsung updates its premium tablet lineup alongside launching a new FE phone . The Galaxy Tab S11 series is out now , but this time it looks a little different. Thereâ€™s no Plus or Pro model to speak of â€” just the standard Galaxy Tab S11 and its uber-packed, equally uber-expensive Ultra sibling. The Galaxy Tab S11 Ultra does give you a few extras besides that massive screen, but if you ask me, Iâ€™d stick with the standard model. Hereâ€™s why.

items.title: The first Snapdragon 8 Elite Gen 5 phones could have ridiculously big batteries
items.summary: The Xiaomi 16 series will be the first next-gen Snapdragon-powered phones, and a leak reveals stupendously large batteries.
items.body: Credit: C. Scott Brown / Android Authority A new Xiaomi 16 series leak suggests major battery upgrades across the board. This varies from 7,000mAh for the compact Xiaomi 16 all the way to 7,500mAh for the purported Xiaomi 16 Pro Max. These will be the first phones with Snapdragon 8 Elite Gen 5 (or Gen 2) processors. Xiaomi will be the first Android brand to offer phones with the Snapdragon 8 Elite Gen 5 (or Snapdragon 8 Elite Gen 2) processor. However, it looks like all three of these upcoming phones could bring impressive batteries. Leaker Yogesh Brar has claimed on Twitter that three Xiaomi 16 series phones are coming, namely the Xiaomi 16, the Xiaomi 16 Pro, and the Xiaomi 16 Pro Max. Furthermore, the tipster says the standard model will have a 7,000mAh battery, the Pro model will have a 6,300mAh battery, and the Pro Max model will top out at 7,500mAh.

items.title: 7 features Iâ€™m excited to try when Gemini lands on my Google Home speakers
items.summary: Gemini is more versatile, more powerful, and more suited for use around the house than Assistant ever was.
items.body: Credit: Adam Molina / Android Authority Gemini support on Google Home and Nest speakers has been a long time coming. The feature has been in preview testing for some lucky US users with specific voices for months now, but Google just announced the exact date when itâ€™ll start showing up for real : October 1. Although this will still be an early access, I canâ€™t wait to get my proverbial hands on it because Iâ€™m sick of Google Assistantâ€™s glitches . The inconsistency, frequent bugs, and silly downgrades have taken the joy out of using a â€œsmartâ€ speaker, to a point where I find myself arguing with it more often than using it. Gemini, however, has been a lot more interesting to use on my Pixel phones and watches, and I canâ€™t help but think that this will be a huge upgrade for everyone. Hereâ€™s why.

items.title: Android 16 QPR1 made my Pixel 9 Pro feel just like a Pixel 10 Pro
items.summary: Yes, Material 3 Expressive really does feel like a breath of fresh air.
items.body: Believe it or not, Iâ€™m not usually one to load up beta software. Itâ€™s cool to try new Android features before theyâ€™re fully baked, but I run into more hiccups than Iâ€™d usually like along the way. However, when Google announced that the Android 16 QPR1 beta was ready for older Pixels, I let my curiosity get the better of me. I wondered what features I would get and which wouldnâ€™t be ready yet. So, I did what only a tech reviewer can: I loaded Android 16 on my Pixel 9 Pro XL to see if it could match my Pixel 10 Pro XL. Hereâ€™s what I found out along the way.

items.title: OnePlus ends Hasselblad camera partnership, reveals whatâ€™s next for OnePlus 15 and beyond
items.summary: The Hasselblad partnership makes way for an in-house imaging engine dubbed OnePlus DetailMax Engine.
items.body: Credit: OnePlus OnePlus has announced the end of its partnership with camera maker Hasselblad. Instead, the mobile brand is working on its own OnePlus DetailMax Engine for photography. The Hasselblad partnership kicked off with 2021â€™s OnePlus 9 Pro. OnePlus first teamed up with Hasselblad for 2021â€™s OnePlus 9 series. This partnership spawned Hasselblad-branded OnePlus flagship phones all the way until the OnePlus 13 . Now, the smartphone maker has confirmed that this tie-up is over. OnePlus co-founder Pete Lau noted in an official blog post that the companyâ€™s â€œplanned chapterâ€ with Hasselblad was now complete after five years. So whatâ€™s next?

items.title: Another Pixel, another 911 failure: Pixel 10 users say emergency calls sound like screeches
items.summary: Previous Pixels have also been unreliable in calling 911, and the Pixel 10 seems to be failing too, albeit differently.
items.body: Credit: Rita El Khoury / Android Authority Pixel 10 series users report that they cannot reliably make 911 calls. The 911 call connects but only delivers garbled, incomprehensible audio, described as â€œshrill electronic screeches.â€ Googleâ€™s Pixel series has had a long history of not connecting 911 calls. This bug is technically different, but the end result is the same. Googleâ€™s Pixel lineup has an unfortunate history of being unable to make 911 calls, a statement that doesnâ€™t incite confidence at all. Reports first emerged in 2021 about Pixels being unable to connect to 911, and the issue was traced to a Microsoft Teams bug and fixed in 2022. More 911 call failure reports emerged in 2023 on Pixels, but Google never acknowledged the problem or publicly issued a fix. It seems even the Pixel 10 series cannot make 911 calls reliably, and thatâ€™s frankly scary at this point. Reddit user YellowWidget had to call 911 for an emergency. Unlike previous Pixels, the call went through. However, the user only heard what they describe as â€œgarbled beeps, shrill electronic screeches, and the occasional ghost of a human word buried in the noise.â€ The user tried four times, but faced the same issue.â€¦

items.title: This YouTube TV discount for existing subscribers is too good to miss
items.summary: It's essentially 40% off, but only for the first two months, unfortunately.
items.body: Credit: Joe Maring / Android Authority YouTube TV is getting a temporary $33 discount for existing users. This brings the cost down to $49.99 a month. You only get the discounted price for two months, but a $66 benefit is better than none. If youâ€™ve switched over from a traditional cable TV, you probably know about virtual providers like YouTube TV, DirecTV, or Hulu. However, if you havenâ€™t and want to explore cutting ties with a traditional TV operator, YouTube TV could be one of the more beneficial options. The base pack starts at $82.99, which isnâ€™t cheap but feels justified for the features it offers . And for its existing customers, YouTube TV is introducing a new discount offer that saves $33 per month. Reddit user oestred recently discovered a discount offer that reduces the monthly cost to $49.99, resulting in a $33 monthly savings. However, you must note that the offer applies only for two months, and your subscription costs will revert to the original price from the third month onwards. Despite that, it doesnâ€™t sound like a bad deal, but you must act quickly, since we donâ€™t know how long the offer will last.

items.title: The best Switch emulator just got a big update, with support for Silksong
items.summary: Silksong is just the icing on the cake of an otherwise massive update.
items.body: Credit: Nick Fernandez / Android Authority The official stable release 0.0.3 of the Switch emulator Eden is now available. It adds performance updates, driver downloads, UI improvements, and bug fixes. The update also adds support for Hollow Knight: Silksong, which released just yesterday. Itâ€™s been just over a month since the Nintendo Switch emulator Eden dropped the release candidate for version 0.0.3, but after a few rounds of revisions, itâ€™s finally ready for a stable release. The Yuzu fork adds a ton of new features and improvements, plus improved game compatibility. For starters, the update features a number of Vulkan, JIT, and CMake bug fixes, which should provide a small performance boost on all machines. That includes Windows, Linux, and of course, Android.

items.title: PSA: Googleâ€™s new Pixel Flex Dual Port 67W charger isnâ€™t the same everywhere
items.summary: It might be missing one travel-friendly feature depending on where you buy it.
items.body: Credit: Robert Triggs / Android Authority Googleâ€™s new Pixel Flex Dual Port 67W charger may be missing one feature depending on where you buy it. Users on Reddit point out that the chargerâ€™s prongs donâ€™t fold as advertised on Googleâ€™s website and Amazon. The lack of foldable prongs may be limited to specific regions, though. Googleâ€™s new Pixel Flex Dual Port 67W charger is surely one of the best accessories you can buy for your Pixel 10 phone. The $59.99 USB-C fast charger uses proprietary tech that can not only prioritize charging your Pixel but also charge a second device simultaneously. Another small but cool advantage of the charger is that itâ€™s supposed to be very travel-friendly, with prongs that fold inside, making it easy to carry around in a small bag without the prongs awkwardly poking out.

items.title: This new Qi2 25W wireless charger lineup is ready for the Pixel 10 Pro XL and iPhone 17 series
items.summary: UGREEN's new MagFlow Qi2 25W line includes power banks, wireless charging pads, and multi-device chargers.
items.body: UGREENâ€™s new MagFlow Qi2 25W line of accessories is designed for the Pixel 10 Pro XL and the upcoming iPhone 17 series. The MagFlow Qi2 25W lineup includes a 10,000mAh power bank, a wireless charging pad, and two- and three-in-one charging stations. The Pixel 10 Pro XL supports Qi2 25W wireless charging, while other Pixel 10 models are limited to 15W. All iPhone 17 series phones are expected to feature Qi2 25W wireless charging. One of the biggest highlights of the Pixel 10 series is Pixelsnap , Googleâ€™s branding for Qi2-based magnets baked into the phones. This allows the Pixel 10 series to be used with a wide variety of Qi2 accessories. If you just grabbed a new Pixel 10 series phone and wanted to get a few accessories to complement it, UGREEN has launched its new MagFlow Qi2 25W lineup for faster magnetic charging. Every Pixel 10 model supports Qi2 charging, but thereâ€™s some nuance involved that you should be aware of. The Pixel 10, Pixel 10 Pro, and Pixel 10 Pro Fold top out at 15W with Qi2-certified chargers when paired with a 20W or higher USB-C adapter. On the other hand, the Pixel 10 Pro XL steps things up with Qi2.2 support, hitting 25W when used with a Qi2.2-certified châ€¦

items.title: The DuRoBo Krono e-reader boasts open Android and a built-in audio player
items.summary: There's a fresh face in the e-reader crowd.
items.body: DuRoBo has unveiled its Krono E-Ink tablet at IFA Berlin, calling it an â€œAI-powered ePaper Focus Hub.â€ The device combines a 6.13-inch E-Ink Carta 1200 display (300ppi) with AI note capture, audio playback, and open Android. It is available for Kickstarter pre-sale now for â‚¬279.99, with shipping expected in November 2025. Most e-readers stick to the basics: an E-Ink screen, a bookstore tie-in, and enough battery to survive a long vacation. At IFA 2025, DuRoBo debuted a more ambitious device, the Krono, pitched as an â€œAI-powered ePaper Focus Hub.â€ This is either a mouthful of marketing or a peek at where these types of devices are indeed headed. On paper (pun intended), the specs look solid. The Krono features a 6.13-inch Carta 1200 HD display at 300ppi with an 18:9 aspect ratio. Under the hood, it runs on an octa-core processor with 6GB of RAM and 128GB of storage, a big jump from the 1GB RAM and 16GB storage youâ€™ll find on most e-readers like a Kindle or Kobo. Powering those beefier internals is a 3,950mAh battery, though DuRoBo hasnâ€™t shared an actual usage estimate.

items.title: These cool earbuds bring crazy translation smarts for your travels
items.summary: The W4 earbuds are a little cheaper than the Pro model while bringing a more conventional design.
items.body: Credit: Supplied by Timekettle Timekettle has launched the W4 translation earbuds. These earbuds offer a more conventional earbud design but still offer real-time translation and automatic mode switching. The earbuds go on sale today for $349. Timekettle has made a name for itself thanks to its translation earbuds . Its recent W4 Pro earbuds automatically translate dozens of languages during speech and calls. Now, the company has announced a new pair of buds. The Timekettle W4 AI Interpreter Earbuds are effectively a less premium version of the W4 Pro buds. However, the standard W4 also differs by offering a conventional earbud design versus the Pro modelâ€™s open-ear form factor.

items.title: Lenovo shows off a concept laptop with a display that rotates to portrait mode
items.summary: It's one a kind, but we've seen a similar concept before â€” from another brand.
items.body: Credit: C. Scott Brown / Android Authority Lenovo has showcased a new concept laptop with a rotating display. The display features a special mechanism that allows switching between landscape and portrait orientations. The concept isnâ€™t coming to the market yet, though it looks close to ready for production. Weâ€™ve seen laptops with dual screens . Weâ€™ve seen laptops with flexible screens that unfold into larger ones . Weâ€™ve even seen laptops with rolling screens that expand for a bigger real estate . Many of these concept-turned-products were showcased by Lenovo, which is now taking unveiling a new concept with another unusual screen layout. This new concept laptop, showcased at IFA 2025 today, embodies the rising trend for portrait monitors with a screen that swivels between portrait and landscape orientations. Lenovoâ€™s new ThinkBook VertiFlex is a proof of concept for a laptop with a screen that rotates along its center. The laptop, internally referred to as Project Pivo, features a 14-inch screen anchored to a mechanism that allows using the same screen in both orientations.

items.title: The Lenovo Legion Go 2 is finally here to put the ROG Xbox Ally in its place
items.summary: The Legion Go 2 wins on specs, but at what cost?
items.body: Credit: C. Scott Brown / Android Authority The Lenovo Legion Go 2 is an updated 8.8-inch Windows handheld. Like the ROG Xbox Ally X, it packs a Z2 Extreme chip, but with a better screen and more RAM. Pricing will start at $1,049, with availability starting in October. Itâ€™s been nearly nine months since Lenovo first showed off the Legion Go 2 prototype at CES, but at long last, itâ€™s finally here to take the spotlight. And boy was it worth it. The updated Windows handheld features top-notch specs across the board. We donâ€™t have all of the SKUs yet, but the specs announced at IFA today list â€œup toâ€ the AMD Ryzen Z2 Extreme and 32GB of RAM. The ROG Xbox Ally X, which was finally revealed last month , ships with the same chip, but maxes out at 24GB of RAM.

items.title: Lenovo undercuts the Galaxy Tab S11 series with a pair of more affordable tablets
items.summary: If the Galaxy Tab S11 is too pricey, Lenovo's new tablets might be just what you're looking for.
items.body: Credit: Lenovo Lenovo is launching two new tablets: the Yoga Tab and Idea Tab Plus. Pricing for the Yoga Tab will start at $549.99 and will go on sale in September. The Idea Tab Plus will be available in October, starting at $269.99. Samsung has finally announced the Galaxy Tab S11 and S11 Ultra . However, itâ€™s not the only tech company launching new Android tablets this week. Lenovo is also using IFA 2025 to debut a pair of its own tablets: the Yoga Tab and Idea Tab Plus. Yoga Tab

items.title: Galaxy S26 Ultra dimensions leak, while mockup render reveals welcome curves
items.summary: Leaked dimensions and a mockup render give us a better idea of what we'll see in January 2026.
items.body: Credit: Joe Maring / Android Authority A Samsung Galaxy S26 Ultra mockup render gives us a rough idea of what to expect when the phone launches. The image shows off more rounded corners than the S25 Ultra, in line with previous leaks. A leaker also posted the S26 Ultraâ€™s dimensions, revealing that itâ€™s slightly taller and wider but thinner than the S25 Ultra. We recently heard that the Samsung Galaxy S26 Ultra could have more rounded corners than the Galaxy S25 Ultra . Now, a long-time leaker has given us a better idea of what we should expect. Ice Universe on Twitter has posted a mockup render of the Galaxy S26 Ultra using leaked dimensions (see the first image below). The image also shows more rounded corners than the current Ultra phone.

items.title: Pixel 10 phones are currently incompatible with Galaxy Watches
items.summary: We can confirm what countless Pixel 10 owners are reporting. The phones are refusing to pair with Samsung's watches.
items.body: Samsungâ€™s Galaxy Watches are having trouble connecting to Pixel 10 series phones right now. The issue seems widespread, and we can also confirm our Galaxy Watch 8 Classic refuses to pair with our Pixel 10 Pro XL unit. Google seems to be aware of the problem, but itâ€™s unclear if a fix is coming anytime soon. If you just picked up a shiny new Pixel 10 series phone and tried pairing it with your Galaxy Watch, chances are youâ€™re running into some connectivity trouble. Reports are piling up across Reddit and Googleâ€™s support forums that Samsungâ€™s watches, especially the Galaxy Watch 8 series, Galaxy Watch 7 series, and Galaxy Watch Ultra, simply refuse to connect to Googleâ€™s flagships over Bluetooth, and we can confirm the issue is very real. On our end, a Galaxy Watch 8 Classic wouldnâ€™t pair at all with the Pixel 10 Pro XL. The setup stops dead at the pairing code stage, whether through the Galaxy Wearable app or manual Bluetooth settings. Resetting the watch and reinstalling Samsung Health as well as the Galaxy Wearable app didnâ€™t help either. We also didnâ€™t have any luck pairing the two together after installing the latest September update on the Pixel 10 Pro XL. Meanwhile, the watcâ€¦

items.summary: England defender Lucy Bronze sits down with Kelly Somers to talk about winning the Euros and life outside of football.

items.title: Deal: This amazing Samsung curved gaming monitor is $600 off!
items.summary: I've always wanted one of these amazing Samsung monitors, and now I can afford it!
items.body: Credit: Samsung via Amazon We reported this deal early last week, but it is so good weâ€™re surprised itâ€™s still around. We thought we would send off a PSA to make sure you donâ€™t miss it! The Samsung Odyssey G95C 49-Inch Curved Gaming Monitor is huge, curved, and comes with great specs. Itâ€™s also at a record-low price of just $699.99 Buy the Samsung Odyssey G95C Monitor for just $699.99 ($600 off)

items.title: The Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra $300 off, but only in these two colors
items.summary: We still think the Galaxy S25 Ultra is the best high-end phone, and it's $300 off today!
items.body: Credit: Ryan Haines / Android Authority Samsungâ€™s most exciting phones right now include foldables, flip phones, and a super-thin phone. These are cool, but if you want true performance and an overall premium experience, you canâ€™t beat the Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra. We would argue it is still Samsungâ€™s best phone, and you can often catch better deals on it. Itâ€™s currently as cheap as $999.99, which is a $300 discount. Buy the Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra for just $999.99 ($300 off)

items.title: Pour one out for the Galaxy Note line as updates come to an end
items.summary: No Notes.
items.body: Credit: Hadlee Simons / Android Authority Samsung has finally ended software support for the Galaxy Note 20 and Note 20 Ultra. The August 2025 patch was their final update, leaving them on One UI 5.1. Fans say theyâ€™ll keep using the phones, but the Note line is now officially over. The Galaxy Note series was iconic in its day, but time waits for no device, and now the last models have finally been cut off. Samsung has stopped supporting the Galaxy Note 20 and Note 20 Ultra, with the August 2025 security patch confirmed as their final update. As spotted on the r/GalaxyNote20 subreddit , the two phones have disappeared from Samsungâ€™s official update list. That means theyâ€™ll remain on Android 13 with One UI 5.1, and owners wonâ€™t see any more monthly or quarterly patches.

items.title: Googleâ€™s Veo 3 lands in Photos, and you donâ€™t need a $250 plan to try it
items.summary: You can get a taste of Googleâ€™s powerful video model in Photos' image-to-video feature.
items.body: Credit: Mishaal Rahman / Android Authority Google Photos is upgrading its image-to-video tool with the Veo 3 AI model. The update creates four-second, silent clips with free but limited use for most subscribers. AI Pro and AI Ultra users get more generations. Google Photos has been making moves to make your snapshots feel more alive, and the tech giant is about to take things one step further. The appâ€™s image-to-video feature is getting an upgrade powered by Googleâ€™s latest AI video model, Veo 3 . According to TechCrunch , the rollout is beginning in the US, and youâ€™ll find the feature inside the Photos appâ€™s Create tab. Until now, the tool has relied on the older Veo 2 model to add subtle motion, or a random effect with an â€œIâ€™m feeling luckyâ€ button. With Veo 3 in place, the results should look sharper and more natural.

items.title: Want the Galaxy S25 FE? This $6 monthly AT&T offer is too good to ignore
items.summary: AT&T's Galaxy S25 FE deal will help you save some money.
items.body: AT&T customers can now order the Galaxy S25 FE. Anybody on an unlimited plan can get the phone at $5.99 per month, no trade-in required. The carrier is also offering 50% off Samsung accessories with the purchase of any Samsung connected device. Samsung said it would introduce the latest member of the Galaxy S25 family today and thatâ€™s exactly what it did. The Galaxy S25 FE has officially launched and is up for sale right now, starting at $649. If youâ€™re an AT&T customer, youâ€™ll be able to save some money on the Fan Edition device with the carrierâ€™s new deal. If youâ€™re thinking of picking up the Galaxy S25 FE, AT&T is offering the device for $5.99 per month. Anyone on an unlimited plan can hop on this deal for a savings of 66% ($435). No trade-ins are required to take advantage of this offer. According to the fine print, this deal is for the 128GB model, so youâ€™ll be out of luck if you want the higher storage option.

items.title: Your old Google phone may be getting this Pixel 9 livestreaming feature
items.summary: Googleâ€™s Connected Cameras tool appears to be sneaking onto older Pixels.
items.body: Credit: C. Scott Brown / Android Authority Pixelâ€™s Connected Cameras feature is appearing on older models, such as the Pixel 6a, 7, and 8 Pro. Googleâ€™s support page still lists the Pixel 9 series as the only officially supported hosts. The tool lets you use another Pixel or GoPro as a remote camera for livestreams in apps like YouTube and TikTok. Googleâ€™s Connected Cameras feature is handy for turning another Pixel phone or GoPro into a remote camera for livestreams. It was initially billed as a Pixel 9-exclusive feature, but weâ€™ve spotted signs of it starting to appear on older models as well. A Pixel 8 Pro owner on Reddit says theyâ€™re now seeing the Connected Cameras toggle in their settings, and theyâ€™re not alone. In Telegram groups, others report the same on the Pixel 6a and Pixel 7 beta builds. Thatâ€™s at odds with Googleâ€™s support page , which still lists the Pixel 9 lineup as the only devices that can host the feature.

items.title: NASA TechRise Student Challenge 5
items.summary: This competition provides a hands-on opportunity for participants to gain critical skills in engineering, computing, electronics, and more that will be required for Americaâ€™s technical workforce. If you are in sixth to 12th-grade at a U.S. public, private, or charter school â€“ including those in U.Sâ€¦
items.body: This competition provides a hands-on opportunity for participants to gain critical skills in engineering, computing, electronics, and more that will be required for Americaâ€™s technical workforce. If you are in sixth to 12th-grade at a U.S. public, private, or charter school â€“ including those in U.S. territories â€“ your challenge is to team up with your schoolmates and develop a science or technology experiment idea for one of the following NASA TechRise flight vehicles: Suborbital-Spaceship with approximately 3 minutes of microgravity. High-Altitude Balloon with approximately 4 to 8 hours of flight time at 70,000 to 95,000 feet and exposure to Earthâ€™s atmosphere, high-altitude radiation, and perspective views of our planet. Award: $1,500 each to 60 winning teams Open Date: September 4, 2025 Close Date: November 3, 2025 For more information, visit: https://www.futureengineers.org/nasatechrise

items.title: Upcoming Launch to Boost NASAâ€™s Study of Sunâ€™s Influence Across Space
items.summary: Soon, there will be three new ways to study the Sunâ€™s influence across the solar system with the launch of a trio of NASA and National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) spacecraft. Expected to launch no earlier than Tuesday, Sept. 23, the missions include NASAâ€™s IMAP (Interstellar Mappiâ€¦
items.body: 6 Min Read Upcoming Launch to Boost NASAâ€™s Study of Sunâ€™s Influence Across Space A flare erupts from the Sun on Feb. 21, 2024. Credits: NASA/SDO Soon, there will be three new ways to study the Sunâ€™s influence across the solar system with the launch of a trio of NASA and National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) spacecraft. Expected to launch no earlier than Tuesday, Sept. 23, the missions include NASAâ€™s IMAP (Interstellar Mapping and Acceleration Probe), NASAâ€™s Carruthers Geocorona Observatory, and NOAAâ€™s SWFO-L1 (Space Weather Follow On-Lagrange 1) spacecraft. The three missions will launch together aboard a SpaceX Falcon 9 rocket from NASAâ€™s Kennedy Space Center in Florida. From there, the spacecraft will travel together to their destination at the first Earth-Sun Lagrange point (L1), around one million miles from Earth toward the Sun. The missions will each focus on different effects of the solar wind â€” the continuous stream of particles emitted by the Sun â€” and space weather â€” the changing conditions in space driven by the Sun â€” from their origins at the Sun to their farthest reaches billions of miles away at the edge of our solar system. Research and observationsâ€¦

items.title: The brightest Google TV projector so far just debuted at IFA 2025
items.summary: XIGIMI's new Horizon 20 Max is the brightest Google TV projector you can find right now.
items.body: XGIMI has unveiled the Horizon 20 Series with Google TV at IFA 2025. The new projector lineup includes the Horizon 20, 20 Pro, and flagship 20 Max with 5,700 ISO lumens. Pre-orders open on September 5 in the US and UK, with shipping beginning in October. XGIMI is turning up the brightness in home entertainment. This afternoon at IFA 2025, the company introduced the Horizon 20 Series, its most luminous projectors yet, featuring Google TV. With this launch, XGIMI sets its sights squarely on home theater heavyweights like Epson and BenQ. The Horizon 20 Series comes in three variants, the Horizon 20, 20 Pro, and flagship 20 Max, but itâ€™s the Max that steals the spotlight. With 5,700 ISO lumens, itâ€™s bright enough to hold its own against daylight or a well-lit living room. That puts it ahead of most portable Google TV projectors and even in the same conversation as mid-range home units from brands like Epson.

items.title: Google is expanding the Pixel Weather app to Wear OS
items.summary: What will Google do with the old Weather app?
items.body: Credit: Kaitlyn Cimino / Android Authority The Pixel Weather app is coming to Wear OS. Pixel Weather on Wear OS has a similar layout to the Weather app, but introduces Material 3 Expressive design. The app is expected to arrive with the Pixel Watch 4, but screenshots are already showing up on the Play Store. Back in 2022, Google gave Wear OS 3 a standalone weather app simply called Weather. It provides pretty much all the information you need from such an app, like the temperature, the daily highs and lows, precipitation chance, and so on. While it has long been a go-to weather app on Wear OS , it looks like itâ€™s about to be overshadowed by an expansion of the Pixel Weather app. The Pixel Weather app is expanding beyond phones and tablets to land on Wear OS. 9to5Google reports that Pixel Weather on Wear OS will have a similar layout to the Weather app, but it will bring Material 3 Expressive design changes.

items.title: NASA, Northrop Grumman to Send Medical, Technology Studies to Space
items.summary: NASA and Northrop Grumman are preparing to send the companyâ€™s next cargo mission to the International Space Station, flying research to support Artemis missions to the Moon and human exploration of Mars and beyond, while improving life on Earth. SpaceXâ€™s Falcon 9 rocket will launch Northrop Grummanâ€¦
items.body: NASA and Northrop Grumman are preparing to send the companyâ€™s next cargo mission to the International Space Station, flying research to support Artemis missions to the Moon and human exploration of Mars and beyond, while improving life on Earth. SpaceXâ€™s Falcon 9 rocket will launch Northrop Grummanâ€™s 23rd commercial resupply services mission to the orbiting laboratory. The investigations aboard the Cygnus spacecraft aim to refine semiconductor crystals for next-generation technologies, reduce harmful microbes, improve medication production, and manage fuel pressure. NASA, Northrop Grumman, and SpaceX are targeting launch in mid-September from Space Launch Complex 40 at Cape Canaveral Space Force Station in Florida. Read about some of the investigations traveling to the space station: Better semiconductor crystals Optical micrograph of a semiconductor composite wafer with embedded semimetal phases extracted from a space grown crystal in the SUBSA facility during Mission 1 United Semiconductors LLC Researchers are continuing to fine-tune in-space production of semiconductor crystals, which are critical for modern devices like cellphones and computers. The space stationâ€™s microgravitâ€¦

items.title: Pixel phones could soon let you set up unique vibrations for each contact (APK teardown)
items.summary: Your Pixel's vibrations might be becoming more personal.
items.body: Credit: Adamya Sharma / Android Authority We spotted Google Contacts code that hints at contact-specific vibration patterns for Pixel phones. Apple and Samsung already allow you to assign specific haptics to your contacts. If it rolls out, the feature would tell you whoâ€™s calling even when your Pixel is in silent mode. Pixel phones already let you set custom ringtones for individual contacts, but Google could be preparing to take things further. Code hidden in the latest version of the Google Contacts app suggests youâ€™ll eventually be able to assign vibration patterns to specific people, so youâ€™ll know whoâ€™s calling even when your phoneâ€™s in silent mode. items.title: AUKEYâ€™s new modular wireless charger is an absolute game changer
items.summary: The Qi2.2-equipped MagFusion Ark comes with detachable spheres that double as a powerbank.
items.body: The worldâ€™s first modular true wireless charger, AUKEY MagFusion Ark The AUKEY MagFusion Ark is a modular wireless charging system with a Qi2.2 multi-pad base and detachable spheres. Each sphere has a 6,700mAh battery, a Qi2.2 charging pad, and a bi-directional 30W USB-C port, making it a portable power bank. The official launch and pricing are expected in Q1 2026. Multiple base plate and sphere configurations are planned. If you thought wireless chargers were boring, hereâ€™s a new one that is pretty damn interesting. At IFA 2025, AUKEY has unveiled the new MagFusion Ark, a modular wireless charger that leverages Qi2.2 with battery-equipped spheres for the ultimate flexibility. AUKEY MagFusion Ark features The AUKEY MagFusion Ark comprises a base plate with up to three Qi2.2 charging pads, depending on your chosen configuration. On top of each of these pads sits a detachable sphere with its own Qi2.2 charging pad. Every single one of these Qi2.2 charging pads can deliver up to 25W fast charging to compatible smartphones.
